title: video y texto
text:
Magic: The Gathering (MTG) is a collectible card game created by mathematics professor Richard Garfield and published by Wizards of the Coast. It was first released in 1993 and has since gained a massive following worldwide.

Gameplay

In MTG, players assume the role of powerful wizards known as Planeswalkers. They use decks of cards representing magical spells, creatures, and artifacts to defeat their opponents. The objective is to reduce the opponent's life total from starting 20 to 0.

Card Types

MTG cards come in various types, including:

  • Creatures: Representing powerful beings and creatures that fight for you.
  • Spells: Encompassing instant spells, sorceries, and enchantments that have different effects on the game.
  • Artifacts: Magical objects that provide unique abilities and effects.
  • Lands: Representing the mana sources needed to cast spells and summon creatures.

Mana System

One unique aspect of MTG is its mana system. Players must tap lands (cards representing magical energy sources) to generate mana, which is used to pay for the casting costs of spells and abilities.

Formats

MTG offers different formats to play, including:

  1. Standard: A rotating format that includes the most recent sets.
  2. Modern: A non-rotating format that includes a larger pool of cards.
  3. Commander: A multiplayer format with unique deck-building rules, centered around legendary creatures.

Markdown Syntax

Markdown is a lightweight markup language used for formatting plain text. Here are some examples of Markdown syntax:

  • Headings: Use hashtags (#) to create headings. The number of hashtags determines the heading level.
  • Lists: Create unordered lists using hyphens (-), and ordered lists using numbers.
  • Links: Use square brackets [] to add link text and parentheses () to enclose the URL.
  • Emphasis: Surround text with asterisks (*) or underscores (_) to make it italic or bold.
  • Code: Use backticks (`) to highlight code snippets or commands.

Markdown provides a simple yet powerful way to format text for easy readability.

To learn more about Markdown syntax, refer to the Markdown Guide.
